components.name: Quality Gate System
components.description: Async quality gate with threshold validation for content pipelines. Supports slop detection, score calculation, and pass/fail determination.
components.example_usage:
from library.quality import QualityGate
gate = QualityGate(threshold=0.7)
result = await gate.check(content)

components.name: Circuit Breaker Pattern
components.description: Generic circuit breaker for non-domain-specific usage.
components.example_usage:
from library.resilience import CircuitBreaker
cb = CircuitBreaker(failure_threshold=5, recovery_timeout=30)
result = await cb.call(async_function)

components.name: Health Check Monitor
components.description: Periodic health polling system with alerting. Monitors service endpoints and triggers callbacks on status changes.
components.example_usage:
from library.monitoring import HealthMonitor
monitor = HealthMonitor(endpoints=[...])
await monitor.start()

components.name: YAML Safe Write
components.description: Atomic YAML file writes with automatic backup. Prevents data loss from interrupted writes or corruption.
components.example_usage:
from library.io import yaml_safe_write
yaml_safe_write('config.yaml', data, backup=True)
components.deprecation_reason: No semantic matches in projects; no evidence of active usage.

components.name: FastAPI CRUD Router
components.description: Standard FastAPI router with CRUD operations, pagination, filtering, and validation. LEGO-compatible: imports from library.common.types for ValidationResult.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.api.fastapi_router import CRUDRouter, create_crud_router
router = create_crud_router(model=Project, schema_create=ProjectCreate, schema_update=ProjectUpdate, schema_response=ProjectResponse, prefix='/projects', tags=['Projects'], get_db=get_db)

components.name: Pydantic Base Models
components.description: Common Pydantic models for FastAPI: pagination, error responses, timestamps, audit, health checks. LEGO-compatible: imports from library.common.types.
components.example_usage: from library.components.api.pydantic_base import PaginatedResponse, ErrorResponse, TimestampMixin, StatusEnum

components.name: Express Middleware Chain
components.description: Standard Express.js middleware setup: CORS, Helmet, rate limiting, request logging, error handling. TypeScript with consistent interface patterns.

components.name: JWT Authentication Middleware
components.description: JWT authentication middleware for Express. Validates tokens, extracts user info, handles refresh tokens.
components.example_usage:
import { jwtAuth } from '@library/auth';
app.use('/api', jwtAuth({ secret: process.env.JWT_SECRET }));

components.name: FastAPI JWT Authentication
components.description: JWT authentication for FastAPI. Dependency injection pattern, token validation, user extraction.

components.name: Database Connection Pool
components.description: PostgreSQL connection pool with health checks, retry logic, and query logging. Async SQLAlchemy pattern.
components.example_usage:
from library.database import create_engine, get_session
engine = create_engine(DATABASE_URL)
async with get_session() as session:

components.name: Radix Dialog Component
components.description: Pre-styled Radix UI Dialog with Tailwind CSS. Includes animations, overlay, close button, header/body/footer sections, size variants, and full accessibility (ARIA, keyboard navigation, focus trap).
components.example_usage:
import { Dialog, DialogTrigger, DialogContent, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogBody, DialogFooter, DialogClose } from '@library/ui/radix-dialog';
<Dialog><DialogTrigger>Open</DialogTrigger><DialogContent><DialogHeader><DialogTitle>Title</DialogTitle></DialogHeader><DialogBody>Content</DialogBody><DialogFooter><DialogClose>Cancel</DialogClose></DialogFooter></DialogContent></Dialog>

components.name: Radix Dropdown Menu Component
components.description: Pre-styled Radix UI Dropdown Menu with Tailwind CSS. Full-featured with submenus, checkbox items, radio groups, separators, labels, icons, keyboard shortcuts display, and complete keyboard navigation.
components.example_usage:
import { DropdownMenu, DropdownMenuTrigger, DropdownMenuContent, DropdownMenuItem, DropdownMenuCheckboxItem, DropdownMenuSeparator, DropdownMenuSub, DropdownMenuSubTrigger, DropdownMenuSubContent } from '@library/ui/radix-dropdown';
<DropdownMenu><DropdownMenuTrigger>Options</DropdownMenuTrigger><DropdownMenuContent><DropdownMenuItem icon={<EditIcon />}>Edit</DropdownMenuItem><DropdownMenuSeparator /><DropdownMenuItem variant='destructive'>Delete</DropdownMenuItem></DropdownMenuContent></DropdownMenu>

components.name: Content Pipeline Template
components.description: 11-phase content pipeline: download, transcribe, analyze, synthesize, draft, style, slop-detect, image-gen, commit, deploy.
components.example_usage:
from library.pipelines import ContentPipeline
pipeline = ContentPipeline(config)
await pipeline.run(source_url)

components.name: Multi-Model Router
components.description: Route tasks to optimal LLM (Claude/Gemini/Codex) based on task characteristics. Supports fallback and load balancing.
components.example_usage:
from library.ai import ModelRouter
router = ModelRouter()
response = await router.route(task)

components.name: Pytest Fixtures Base
components.description: Common pytest fixtures: async client, database session, mock user, test data factories.

components.name: Jest Setup Base
components.description: Common Jest setup: React Testing Library, mock providers, test utilities, custom matchers.
components.example_usage:
// jest.setup.ts
import '@library/testing/jest-setup';

components.name: FrozenHarness Evaluation System
components.description: Immutable evaluation harness for grading artifacts.
components.example_usage: from loopctl.core import FrozenHarness

components.name: TelemetryBridge Memory MCP Integration
components.description: Bridges loop telemetry with Memory MCP storage.
components.example_usage: from integration.telemetry_bridge import TelemetryBridge

components.name: ConnascenceBridge Quality Analyzer
components.description: 7-Analyzer Suite bridge.
components.example_usage: from integration.connascence_bridge import ConnascenceBridge

components.name: ModeLibrary Configuration System
components.description: Pareto-optimal configuration modes.
components.example_usage: from modes.library import get_mode

components.name: VCL Validator
components.description: Validates VERILINGUA v3.1.1 compliance.
components.example_usage: from core.vcl_validator import VCLValidator

components.name: Two-Stage Multi-Objective Optimizer
components.description: GlobalMOO 5D + PyMOO NSGA-II 14D optimization.
components.example_usage: from optimization.two_stage_optimizer import TwoStageOptimizer

components.name: CLI Evaluator (Real LLM)
components.description: Real LLM-based evaluation using Claude CLI.
components.example_usage: from evals.cli_evaluator import CLIEvaluator

components.name: Money Handling Pattern
components.description: CRITICAL: Decimal-based currency handling that REJECTS float entirely. Prevents precision errors in financial calculations. Includes Money class, arithmetic operations, formatting, and validation.
components.example_usage:
from library.patterns.money_handling import Money, FloatNotAllowedError
m = Money(Decimal('19.99'), 'USD')  # OK
m = Money(19.99)  # RAISES FloatNotAllowedError

components.name: Webhook Idempotency Pattern
components.description: CRITICAL: Prevents duplicate webhook processing via cached responses and distributed locking. Supports InMemory, Redis, and PostgreSQL backends. Includes FastAPI middleware and decorators.
components.example_usage:
from library.patterns.webhook_idempotency import idempotent, RedisIdempotencyStore
store = RedisIdempotencyStore(redis_client)
@idempotent(store)
async def handle_webhook(request): ...

components.name: Plaid Banking Integration
components.description: Plaid API client for bank account linking and transaction retrieval. Uses Decimal for all monetary values. Supports sandbox, development, and production environments.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.banking.plaid import PlaidClient
client = PlaidClient(environment='sandbox')
accounts = client.get_accounts(access_token)

components.name: Banking Data Models
components.description: Common banking dataclasses: BankAccount, Transaction, BankConnection. Uses Decimal for all monetary values. Provider-agnostic design.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.banking import BankAccount, Transaction
account = BankAccount(id='acc_123', name='Checking', balance=Decimal('1000.00'))

components.name: Transaction Store
components.description: SQLite-based transaction storage with Decimal amounts. Includes TransactionQuery builder for flexible filtering. Supports accounts, transactions, and spending aggregations.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.accounting import TransactionStore, TransactionQuery
store = TransactionStore('data/transactions.db')
recent = store.get_recent_transactions(days=30)

components.name: Trading Circuit Breakers
components.description: Trading-specific circuit breakers and risk thresholds.

components.name: Gate System Manager
components.description: Capital-based gate system (G0-G12) with progressive position sizing and risk scaling. Async-safe state transitions. Supports gate upgrades and downgrades.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.trading.gate_system import GateManager
gm = GateManager()
current_gate = gm.calculate_gate(capital=Decimal('5000'))

components.name: Kelly Criterion Calculator
components.description: Position sizing using Kelly Criterion with fractional Kelly support. Decimal-only calculations, configurable max position size, and risk-adjusted returns.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.trading.position_sizing import KellyCalculator
kelly = KellyCalculator(fraction=Decimal('0.5'))
size = kelly.calculate(win_rate=Decimal('0.55'), win_loss_ratio=Decimal('1.5'))

components.name: Backtest Harness
components.description: Generic backtesting framework with event-driven architecture. Supports multiple data sources, custom strategies, and comprehensive metrics (Sharpe, Sortino, max drawdown).
components.example_usage:
from library.components.testing.backtest_harness import BacktestEngine
engine = BacktestEngine(strategy=my_strategy)
results = engine.run(data=historical_data)

components.name: Security JWT Authentication
components.description: JWT authentication with secure secret validation, issuer verification, and RS256/HS256 support. Includes FastAPI dependencies and middleware.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.security.jwt_auth import JWTAuth
auth = JWTAuth(secret_key=os.environ['JWT_SECRET'])
token = auth.create_token(user_id='123')

components.name: WHO/WHEN/PROJECT/WHY Tagging Protocol
components.description: Standardized tagging protocol for Memory MCP writes. Enforces WHO, WHEN, PROJECT, WHY metadata on all memory operations.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.observability.tagging_protocol import TaggedEntry
entry = TaggedEntry(who='agent:1.0', project='trader-ai', why='bugfix')

components.name: Audit Logging System
components.description: Structured audit logging with diff tracking, batch operations, and async support. Tracks changes for compliance and debugging.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.observability.audit_logging import AuditLogger
logger = AuditLogger()
await logger.log_change(entity='user', action='update', diff=changes)

components.name: Redis Pub/Sub Manager
components.description: Thread-safe Redis pub/sub with connection verification, exponential backoff retry, and async callback support. Prevents race conditions in subscription management.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.messaging.redis_pubsub import RedisPubSub
pubsub = RedisPubSub(redis_client)
await pubsub.subscribe('channel', callback)

components.name: Redis Cache Layer
components.description: Redis caching with TTL, namespacing, and JSON serialization. Uses SCAN instead of KEYS for production safety.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.caching.redis_cache import RedisCache
cache = RedisCache(redis_client, namespace='app')
await cache.set('key', value, ttl=3600)

components.name: Spec Validation Framework
components.description: JSON Schema and Pydantic-based spec validation with detailed error messages. Supports custom validators and nested object validation.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.validation.spec_validation import SpecValidator
validator = SpecValidator(schema=my_schema)
result = validator.validate(data)

components.name: Memory MCP Client v2
components.description: Thread-safe Memory MCP client with connection pooling, race condition prevention, and proper async lock patterns. Supports triple-layer (24h/7d/30d) memory.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.memory.memory_mcp_client import MemoryMCPClient
client = MemoryMCPClient()
await client.store('key', value, layer='mid-term')

components.name: Fetch API Client
components.description: TypeScript fetch wrapper with AbortController support, automatic JSON parsing, error handling, and configurable timeouts. SSR-compatible.

components.name: Kanban Store (Zustand)
components.description: Zustand-based Kanban state management with drag-and-drop support, optimistic updates, and persistence. Includes column/task CRUD operations.
components.example_usage:
import { useKanbanStore } from '@library/state';
const { columns, addTask, moveTask } = useKanbanStore();

components.name: Design System Components
components.description: React design system with Button, Card, Input, Badge, and Tooltip components. Tailwind-based styling with theme support.
components.example_usage:
import { Button, Card, Input } from '@library/ui';
<Card><Input /><Button>Submit</Button></Card>

components.name: LLM Council Consensus Display
components.description: React components for displaying LLM Council consensus results. Shows model votes, agreement percentages, and dissent explanations.
components.example_usage:
import { ConsensusDisplay } from '@library/ai';
<ConsensusDisplay result={councilResult} />

components.name: API Service Layer
components.description: TypeScript service classes for API endpoints: UserService, ProjectService, AgentService, etc. Uses fetch-api-client under the hood.
components.example_usage:
import { UserService } from '@library/http';
const users = await UserService.list({ page: 1 });

components.name: VERIX Epistemic Parser
components.description: Parser for VERIX epistemic notation. Extracts confidence scores, grounding sources, and illocutionary acts from marked-up text. ReDoS-protected regex patterns.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.cognitive.verix_parser import VerixParser
parser = VerixParser()
result = parser.parse('[assert|neutral] claim [conf:0.9]')

components.name: Cognitive Frame Configuration
components.description: Configuration system for VERILINGUA cognitive frames. Manages frame weights, mode selection, and threshold settings.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.cognitive.cognitive_config import CognitiveConfig
config = CognitiveConfig.load('audit')

components.name: Skill Validator
components.description: Validates Context Cascade skill definitions. Checks required sections, VCL compliance, and skill chaining references.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.validation.skill_validator import SkillValidator
validator = SkillValidator()
result = validator.validate_file('skill.md')

components.name: Markdown Metadata Parser
components.description: Extracts frontmatter and structured metadata from markdown files. Supports YAML frontmatter and inline metadata blocks.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.parsing.markdown_metadata import parse_frontmatter
meta, content = parse_frontmatter(markdown_text)

components.name: OpenTelemetry Lite Wrapper
components.description: Lightweight OpenTelemetry wrapper for tracing and metrics. Configurable exporters, span context propagation, and metric aggregation.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.observability.otel import OTelTracer
with OTelTracer.span('operation'):
    do_work()

components.name: Pattern Matcher
components.description: Generic pattern detection with injectable pattern database. LRU-cached regex compilation with error handling. Supports multi-pattern matching.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.analysis.pattern_matcher import PatternMatcher
matcher = PatternMatcher(patterns=slop_patterns)
matches = matcher.find_all(text)

components.name: Scoring Aggregator
components.description: Weighted score aggregation with configurable grading schemes. Input validation, tuple length checks, and grade calculation.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.analysis.scoring_aggregator import ScoringAggregator
agg = ScoringAggregator(weights={'accuracy': 0.4, 'speed': 0.6})
score = agg.aggregate(scores)

components.name: Violation Factory
components.description: Generic violation/issue creation with standardized schema. SARIF-compatible output, severity comparison, and location tracking.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.analysis.violation_factory import ViolationFactory
v = ViolationFactory.create(severity='high', message='Issue found', line=42)

components.name: Statistical Analyzer
components.description: Text statistics: entropy, burstiness, TTR (Type-Token Ratio), hapax legomena, sentence analysis. Configurable thresholds for quality assessment.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.analysis.statistical_analyzer import StatisticalAnalyzer
analyzer = StatisticalAnalyzer()
stats = analyzer.analyze(text)

components.name: Report Generator
components.description: Multi-format report generation (TEXT, MARKDOWN, JSON). Configurable section ordering, severity grouping, and summary statistics.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.reporting.report_generator import ReportGenerator
gen = ReportGenerator(format='markdown')
report = gen.generate(violations)

components.name: Quality Validator
components.description: Evidence-based quality validation with configurable gates. Theater detection for fake quality indicators. Float comparison epsilon handling.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.validation.quality_validator import QualityValidator
v = QualityValidator(threshold=0.8)
result = v.validate(metrics)

components.name: WebSocket Connection Manager
components.description: Async WebSocket connection manager with heartbeat, reconnection, and Redis backing for horizontal scaling. Thread-safe connection tracking and message broadcasting.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.realtime.websocket_manager import WebSocketManager
manager = WebSocketManager(redis_client)
await manager.connect(websocket, user_id)

components.name: Auditor Base Pattern
components.description: Abstract base class for structured auditors with VERIX-compatible output. Includes Illocution, Affect, ActionClass enums and AuditorResult dataclass with confidence ceiling enforcement.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.patterns.auditor_base import BaseAuditor, AuditorResult
class MyAuditor(BaseAuditor):
    auditor_type = 'custom'
    def audit(self, artifact, eval_report, config): ...

components.name: Image Generator Base Pattern
components.description: Abstract base class for pluggable image generation with provider registry. Supports local models (SDXL, SD1.5), APIs (OpenAI, Replicate). Priority-based provider selection prefers local over API.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.patterns.image_generator_base import ImageGeneratorBase, ProviderRegistry
class MyGenerator(ImageGeneratorBase):
    provider = ImageProvider.CUSTOM
    def generate(self, prompt, output_path, config=None): ...

components.name: AST Visitor Base Pattern
components.description: Base visitor classes for Python AST traversal during code analysis. Includes concrete visitors for magic literals (CoM), parameter bombs (CoP), god objects (CoA), and cyclomatic complexity.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.analysis.ast_visitor_base import BaseConnascenceVisitor, VisitorContext
class MyVisitor(BaseConnascenceVisitor):
    def get_violation_type(self): return 'custom'
    def visit_FunctionDef(self, node): ...

components.name: Stripe Payment Integration
components.description: Production-ready async Stripe integration with payment intents, customers, subscriptions, and secure webhook handling with HMAC verification.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.payments.stripe import StripeClient
client = StripeClient()
intent = await client.create_payment_intent_async(Money(Decimal('19.99'), 'USD'))

components.name: Mercury Bank Integration
components.description: Async Mercury banking API client for accounts, transactions, ACH transfers, and recipient management. Decimal-only money handling.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.banking.mercury import MercuryClient
async with MercuryClient() as client:
    accounts = await client.get_accounts()

components.name: Transaction Categorizer
components.description: ML-based transaction categorization using scikit-learn. Rule-based matching for known merchants, trainable classifier for unknown transactions.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.accounting.categorizer import TransactionCategorizer
categorizer = TransactionCategorizer()
result = categorizer.categorize('STARBUCKS #1234')

components.name: Task Scheduler
components.description: Async task scheduling for FastAPI with APScheduler backend. Supports interval, cron, and one-time jobs with decorator-based registration.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.scheduling.task_scheduler import TaskScheduler
scheduler = TaskScheduler()
@scheduler.cron(hour=2)
async def nightly_job(): ...

components.name: Pipeline Executor
components.description: Lightweight async pipeline executor with DAG-based dependency resolution, parallel execution, retry with backoff, and step result caching.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.orchestration.pipeline_executor import PipelineExecutor
executor = PipelineExecutor()
@executor.step('fetch')
async def fetch(): ...

components.name: React Hooks Library
components.description: Production React hooks: useLocalStorage (cross-tab sync, SSR-safe), useAsyncState (loading/error states, race condition prevention), useAbortableAsyncState.
components.example_usage:
import { useLocalStorage, useAsyncState } from '@library/react-hooks';
const [theme, setTheme] = useLocalStorage('theme', 'light');

components.name: Skill Base Class
components.description: Abstract base class for Context Cascade skills with lifecycle management, metadata registry, hook integration, and composite skill patterns.

components.name: Agent Base Class
components.description: Abstract base class for Context Cascade agents with Memory MCP integration, quality gates, artifact contracts, and composite agent patterns.

components.name: Command Base Class
components.description: Abstract base class for Context Cascade slash commands with argument parsing, skill binding, alias support, and help generation.

components.name: Playbook Base Class
components.description: Abstract base class for Context Cascade playbooks with multi-phase orchestration, checkpoint/recovery, and skill/agent coordination.

components.name: Hook Base Class
components.description: Abstract base class for Claude Code hooks with lifecycle event interception, state persistence, compliance tracking, and pattern retention.

components.name: Script Base Class
components.description: Abstract base class for automation scripts with CLI argument parsing, cron scheduling, structured logging, and timeout handling.

components.name: Metric Collector
components.description: Prometheus-compatible metrics collector with Counter, Gauge, Histogram types, thread-safe updates, and text exposition format.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.analysis.metric_collector import MetricCollector, create_quality_collector
collector = create_quality_collector()
collector.counter('violations_total').labels(severity='high').inc()

components.name: WebSocket Manager
components.description: Production-ready WebSocket connection management with room support, broadcasting, and optional Redis pub/sub for horizontal scaling.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.realtime.websocket_manager import ConnectionManager
manager = ConnectionManager()
await manager.connect(websocket, room_id)
await manager.broadcast_to_room(room_id, message)

components.name: React Auth Context
components.description: Type-safe authentication context with hooks for React applications. Supports JWT, OAuth, token refresh, and protected routes.
components.example_usage:
import { AuthProvider, useAuth } from 'library/react-auth/context';
const { login, logout, isAuthenticated, user } = useAuth();

components.name: AST Visitor Base
components.description: Extended AST visitor with violation collection, path tracking, and pattern matching for code analysis. Uses common/types for LEGO compatibility.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.analysis.ast_visitor import AnalysisVisitor, visit_file
class MyChecker(AnalysisVisitor): ...
violations = visit_file('code.py', MyChecker)

components.name: Multi-Entity Tenant Isolation
components.description: Row-Level Security (RLS) based tenant isolation for SQLAlchemy. Automatic tenant_id injection, PostgreSQL RLS policies, and ASGI middleware.
components.example_usage:
from library.components.multi_entity.isolation import TenantContext, TenantMixin
class Project(TenantMixin, Base): ...
with TenantContext('tenant_123'): ...

components.name: Pytest Fixtures Collection
components.description: LEGO-compatible pytest fixture collection for FastAPI + SQLAlchemy async testing. Includes event loop, database session, HTTP client, mock fixtures, and test data factories.
components.example_usage:
from pytest_fixtures import event_loop, db_session, async_client, mock_db_session
from pytest_fixtures.factories import UserFactory, ProjectFactory

async def test_create(db_session):
    user = UserFactory.create()
    db_session.add(user)

components.name: Jest Setup Collection
components.description: LEGO-compatible Jest + React Testing Library setup for React 18/19 projects. Includes custom render with providers, mock utilities, and custom matchers.

components.name: Status Registry
components.description: Canonical status registry for the AI Exoskeleton doc set. Generates JSON source of truth and renders markdown summaries.
components.example_usage: from library.components.observability.status_registry import build_registry, render_markdown

components.name: Library Drift Audit
components.description: Component-by-component audit of library drift across repos. Compares imports and on-disk copies of library components.
components.example_usage: from library.components.observability.library_drift_audit import build_report

accounting.description: Transaction storage, categorization, and financial reporting

banking.description: Banking integrations and data models (Plaid, Mercury, Stripe)

memory.description: Memory MCP clients and persistence patterns

patterns.description: Reusable design patterns for common problems (CRITICAL: money-handling, webhook-idempotency)

security.description: Security components: JWT auth, encryption, validation

trading.description: Trading system components: circuit breakers, gate system, position sizing

validation.description: Input validation, schema validation, and quality gates
